slidelink.displaytext: Check for Understanding: National Security System ICT
Check for Understanding: Maintenance or Monitoring Spaces ICT
Check for Understanding: Incidental to Federal Contract
Undue Burden or Fundamental Nature Change Exception Requirements
Check for understanding: Undue Burden or Fundamental Nature Change

search.slidetext: introduction roughly 1 in 4 adults lives with some kind of disability. section 508 requires that information and communication technology used, maintained, bought, or built by the federal government is accessible to persons with disabilities.
outside the scope of section 508? section 508 applies section 508 does not apply

training objectives by the end of this training, you will be able to: accurately identify what categories of information and communication technology can be excepted from section 508 requirements correctly identify the section 508 exception that requires additional requirements or documentation explain what additional requirements or documentation is required for the section 508 exception that requires it

information and communication technology (ict) section 508 defines information and communication technology, or ict, as: “information technology and other equipment, systems, technologies, or processes, for which the principal function is the creation, manipulation, storage, display, receipt, or transmission of electronic data and information, as well as any associated content.” examples of ict include, but are not limited to: computers and peripheral equipment information kiosks and transaction machines telecommunications equipment ex: telephones and other real-time communication devices customer premises equipment multifunction office machines ex: machines that scan, fax, and print software applications web sites videos electronic documents ex: word, pdf, powerpoint, excel documents posted online

please click on each exception category, read the description, and do the “check understanding”. you can advance once you have completed the entirety of each category. undue burden or fundamental nature change in the case that making the ict compliant will result in undue burden to the agency with the ict or result in a change to the fundamental nature of the ict, it only has to comply with the revised section 508 standards to the extent it does not place an undue burden on the agency or change the fundamental nature of the ict. important: in the case of undue burden, the agency must provide an alternate means of accessing the information that is accessible to individuals with disabilities. check understanding check understanding check understanding check understanding completed check understanding incidental to federal contract when a contractor acquires ict for her/his own use to fulfill a federal government contract, this ict is not required to conform to section 508 standards. this is what “ict acquired incidentally to a federal contract” means. this exception does not apply in any of the following cases: the government will assume ownership of the ict after the contract ends the government directly procures the ict government employees or the public use the ict. check understanding check understanding check understanding check understanding completed check understanding maintenance or monitoring spaces ict ict located in areas where service personnel only go to service, repair, or monitor will be excluded from section 508 compliance. check understanding check understanding check understanding check understanding completed check understanding national security system ict national security system ict does not need to comply with section 508 standards. “national security system” ict is defined as federal government ict that is one of the following: involves intelligence activities involves cryptologic activities related to national security involves command and control of military forces involves equipment that is an integral part of a weapon or weapons system is critical to the direct fulfillment of military or intelligence missions (does not include routine administrative and business applications such as payroll, finance, logistics, and personnel management) check understanding check understanding check understanding check understanding completed check understanding legacy ict any component or portion of existing ict that meets these three conditions shall not need to comply with the revised 508 standards: deployed, maintained, or used on or before january 18, 2018 compliant with an earlier version of section 508 has not been altered on or after january 18, 2018 check understanding check understanding check understanding check understanding completed check understanding section 508 exceptions legacy ict national security system ict incidental to federal contract undue burden or fundamental nature change maintenance or monitoring spaces ict click on each category image to learn about section 508 exceptions.

how to provide alternate means click on the items below to read some examples of how to provide alternate means to access data. provide a non-technological way to access the data. example: provide a braille paper form as an alternative to an online form that is not fully compliant. provide a non-technological way to access the data. provide an alternate, accessible digital means to access the data. example: direct to an alternate website that provides the same data that is screen reader compatible. provide an alternate, accessible digital means to access the data.

are you ready to submit your answer to this question? confirmation for attempt 1 of 2 confirmation for attempt 2 of 2 confirmation for attempt 1 of 2 submit submit submit submit completed submit cancel cancel cancel completed cancel incorrect that is not correct. look back at the different definitions of what a national security system is. then identify which choices match those definitions. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect you did not select the correct response. a relates to intelligence activities, b relates to cryptologic activities, c relates to weapon systems, e relates to control of military forces, but d (personnel management application) is a routine admin or business application that is excluded from national security systems that are ”critical to the direct fulfillment of military or intelligence missions”. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. a relates to intelligence activities, b relates to cryptologic activities, c relates to weapon systems, e relates to control of military forces, but d (personnel management application) is a routine admin or business application that is excluded from national security systems that are ”critical to the direct fulfillment of military or intelligence missions”. continue continue continue continue continue continue which of these are national security system ict (and therefore can be an exception to section 508 requirements)? multiple answers possible. select all correct answer(s), then click on the submit (checkmark) button on the bottom-right of the player to submit. a. portable surveillance devices for gathering intelligence a. portable surveillance devices for gathering intelligence b. terminal for decrypting malicious communications b. terminal for decrypting malicious communications e. navigation display for steering aircraft carrier e. navigation display for steering aircraft carrier c. command interface for attack missile c. command interface for attack missile d. personnel management application critical for military administration d. personnel management application critical for military administration national security system ict

are you ready to submit your answer to this question? confirmation for attempt 1 of 2 confirmation for attempt 2 of 2 confirmation for attempt 1 of 2 submit submit submit submit completed submit cancel cancel cancel completed cancel incorrect that is not correct. maintenance and monitoring spaces are frequented only by service personnel for maintenance, repair, etc. and not accessed by general workers. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect you did not select the correct response. service personnel only will go into the server room and check the panel beneath the aircraft wing. however, many general workers will go into the copy room and dining area, so those spaces are not maintenance and monitoring spaces. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. service personnel only will go into the server room and check the panel beneath the aircraft wing. however, many general workers will go into the copy room and dining area, so those spaces are not maintenance and monitoring spaces. continue continue continue continue continue continue which of these are ict in a maintenance or monitoring space? multiple answers possible. select all correct answer(s), then click on the submit (checkmark) button on the bottom-right of the player to submit. which of these are ict in a maintenance or monitoring space? multiple answers possible. select all correct answer(s), then click on the submit (checkmark) button on the bottom-right of the player to submit. a. a server room: sole purpose is housing web servers a. a server room: sole purpose is housing web servers b. copy machine in copy room, used by most workers in office b. copy machine in copy room, used by most workers in office d. status display beneath wing of a military jet d. status display beneath wing of a military jet c. information kiosk in common lunch room c. information kiosk in common lunch room maintenance or monitoring spaces ict

are you ready to submit your answer to this question? confirmation for attempt 1 of 2 confirmation for attempt 2 of 2 confirmation for attempt 1 of 2 submit submit submit submit completed submit cancel cancel cancel completed cancel reminder: any component or portion of existing ict that meets these three conditions shall not need to comply with the revised 508 standards: 1. deployed, maintained, or used on or before january 18, 2018 2. compliant with an earlier version of section 508 3. has not been altered on or after january 18, 2018 incorrect that is not correct. check the description against the three criteria that qualifies an ict for the legacy ict exception. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect you did not select the correct response. this ict does not meet the third criterion, which requires that the ict must have not been altered since january 18, 2018. therefore, this ict does not qualify as legacy ict and is not excepted from section 508. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! this ict does not meet the third criterion, which requires that the ict must have not been altered since january 18, 2018. therefore, this ict does not qualify as legacy ict and is not excepted from section 508. continue continue continue continue continue continue true true true true true true false false false false false false this piece of equipment is legacy ict and excepted from section 508 requirements. true or false? after you have chosen true or false, click on the submit (checkmark) button on the bottom-right of the player to submit your answer. relevant facts about this ict: purchased in 1980 and modified in 1992 to display temperature scans has been used since 1992 to today for the above purpose was made compliant to section 508 standards in 2012 its user interface was updated most recently in 2019 to reflect most recent best design practices legacy ict

undue burden or fundamental nature change exception requirements additionally, the agency must perform the following to be eligible for the undue burden or fundamental nature change exception: evaluate whether the proposed compliance change would lead to significant difficulty or expense considering the agency resources available to the program or component or would change the fundamental nature of the ict. provide documentation of: the basis for determining that the conformance would lead to undue burden or a fundamental change to the nature of the ict. an explanation of why and to what extent compliance with section 508 requirements would create an undue burden or result in fundamental alteration of the nature of the ict.

are you ready to submit your answer to this question? confirmation for attempt 1 of 2 confirmation for attempt 2 of 2 confirmation for attempt 1 of 2 submit submit submit submit completed submit cancel cancel cancel completed cancel incorrect that is not correct. it may help to break the necessary procedures into what needs to be done first, and then what needs to be documented. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect you did not select the correct response. after evaluating whether compliance would lead to undue burden or a fundamental nature change, you need documentation for the basis for determining this and documentation explaining why and to what extent complying would lead to undue burden or fundamental nature change in the ict. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! after evaluating whether compliance would lead to undue burden or a fundamental nature change, you need documentation for the basis for determining this and documentation explaining why and to what extent complying would lead to undue burden or fundamental nature change in the ict. continue continue continue continue continue continue explain why and to what extent complying with section 508 would cause undue burden or fundamental nature change (**documented in writing) define the basis for determining that the conformance would lead to undue burden or a fundamental nature change (**documented in writing) evaluate whether compliance would lead to significant difficulty or expense, or fundamentally change the nature of the ict (**done before documentation) what must be performed to establish an exception to section 508 based on undue burden or fundamental change to the nature of the ict? correctly match the first word of a sentence (on the left) with the rest of the sentence (select from the dropdown menu). when you have matched all sentence parts together, click on the submit (checkmark) button on the bottom-right of the player. undue burden or fundamental nature change exception requirements

next: quiz now that you have learned about exceptions to section 508, you will be given a quiz to check your understanding. there are five questions on the quiz. you will have two attempts for each question. the passing score for the quiz is 70%. this score will be recorded and reviewed by the learning and development team to assess learning and the effectiveness of this training. it may help to review the material before starting the quiz. to do so, press the “back” button on the player to return to previous slides.

drag and drop the required procedures to the “required” folder, then click on the submit (checkmark) button on the bottom-right of the player. alternatively, click this link for an alternative text-based version of this question. procedures evaluate whether the proposed compliance change would lead to significant difficulty or expense. evaluate whether the proposed compliance change would lead to significant difficulty or expense. evaluate whether the proposed compliance change would lead to significant difficulty or expense. inform your ada representative. inform your ada representative. inform your ada representative. provide an alternate means of accessing the information that is accessible to individuals with disabilities provide an alternate means of accessing the information that is accessible to individuals with disabilities provide an alternate means of accessing the information that is accessible to individuals with disabilities provide supporting documentation. provide supporting documentation. provide supporting documentation. run usability tests with individuals with disabilities to assess impact on their usage of the ict. run usability tests with individuals with disabilities to assess impact on their usage of the ict. run usability tests with individuals with disabilities to assess impact on their usage of the ict. required

of 5

summary here is a summary of what you learned in this training module: section 508 requires information and communication technology (ict) used, maintained, bought, or built by the federal government to be accessible to people with disabilities. information and communication technology is defined by section 508 to be any technology, equipment, system, or process whose principal function is to create, manipulate, store, display, receive, or transmit electronic data or information and associated content. there are five exceptions to the requirement that ict meets section 508 accessibility standards: legacy ict, national security systems, maintenance or monitoring spaces, incidental to federal contract, and undue burden or fundamental nature change the undue burden or fundamental nature change exception requires i) providing disabled individuals access to an alternative means of accessing the information, and ii) the following additional procedures: an evaluation of whether the proposed compliance change would cause significant difficulty or expense (”undue burden”) to the agency or change the fundamental nature of the ict documentation of: the basis for determining that conformance would lead to undue burden or a fundamental change to the nature of the ict explanation of why and to what extent compliance with section 508 requirements would create an undue burden or result in fundamental alteration of the nature of the ict

module complete congratulations on learning about exceptions to section 508! at this point, you should be able to: accurately identify what categories of information and communication technology can be excepted from section 508 requirements correctly identify the section 508 exception that requires additional requirements or documentation explain what additional requirements or documentation is required for the section 508 exception that requires it in the next module, you will learn exactly how to complete the additional requirements or documentation noted in item 3 above. press the “next” button on the bottom right of the player to complete this training module or the “back” button to review. if you have any questions about the content covered in this training, please send a message to the learning and development team.

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

terms.term:
Information technology and other equipment, systems, technologies, or processes, for which the principal function is the creation, manipulation, storage, display, receipt, or transmission of electronic data and information, as well as any associated content.
Examples of ICT include, but are not limited to: computers and peripheral equipment; information kiosks and transaction machines; telecommunications equipment; customer premises equipment; multifunction office machines; software; applications; Web sites; videos; and, electronic documents.
